subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas
author: April Abercrombie
full_text:
------=_NextPart_000_01CA_01C9E843.D5CF8650
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

How cool is that??

  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: Frank Ratka 
  =
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Monday, June 08, 2009 1:56 PM
  Subjec=
t: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas





        "But the fact that one recorder wou=
ld pick up something and another recorder just inches away would not does s=
upport the theory about it being transmitted right next to or directly on t=
he electronics that write to the media."

        This will blow your mind =
also. With Dr. Pompeii's audio spotlight he can cause sound to manifest in =
3D space as a bubble of sound. A person standing right next to you could no=
t hear the music if you encased you in the bubble. The same works for his s=
ound beam. To this day many museums use his audio system to transmit displa=
y information without all the sounds mixing and messing up your museum expe=
rience. The sound is produced with ultrasonic transducers instead of the tr=
aditional electrostatic speakers we all use.

        Frank R.

        ---=
 On Mon, 6/8/09, April Abercrombie <april@...> wro=
te:


          From: April Abercrombie <april@...=
>
          Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas
          To: EVP-ITC@yahoogro=
ups.com
          Date: Monday, June 8, 2009, 2:47 PM


          Yes, you =
are right. Sorry, I am just beginning to learn about this area of research.=
 Everything omits radiation at different levels. 

          What I should =
have said is that true EVP aren't produced via sound waves in the range of =
human hearing. But the fact that one recorder would pick up something and a=
nother recorder just inches away would not does support the theory about it=
 being transmitted right next to or directly on the electronics that write =
to the media.

          Sorry, my knowledge is very limited in this area s=
o my terms may be incorrect or insufficient. Please correct me at will so I=
 may learn all this properly.

          April

            ----- Original =
Message ----- 
            From: Frank Ratka 
            To: EVP-ITC@yahoo=
groups .com 
            Sent: Monday, June 08, 2009 1:38 PM
            Su=
bject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas


                  It sounds like she's say=
ing "one, two, ....."

                  A mistake that a lot of people mak=
e is thinking that there are two different types of energy at work when it =
comes to sound waves and electromagnetic waves. The only thing that seperat=
es them is frequency and power. Radio waves are radio waves because they oc=
cupy a certain block of the electromagnietic spectrum. Sound waves exist on=
 that same spectrum just farther down with much longer waves. Soundwaves an=
d subsonic waves can penetrate almost anything because of their wavelengths=
. The shorter the wavelength the more ways we can shield against them.

   =
               Think of microwaves. These are also a type of radio and tele=
metry transmitting wave but the waves also have a physical effect on our en=
vironment by causing molecules to speed up, which creates heat. A little lo=
wer than this is IR or infrared it too can cause physical objects to heat u=
p but usually it just causes molecules to rotate in place. All physical thi=
ngs give off IR light. Its a way the total system conserves energy by spont=
aneously emitting IR radiation.

                  Frank R.

              =
    --- On Mon, 6/8/09, April Abercrombie <april@abercrombiegh ostresearch.=
 com> wrote:


                    From: April Abercrombie <april@abercromb=
iegh ostresearch. com>
                    Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas=
 [3 Attachments]
                    To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
         =
           Date: Monday, June 8, 2009, 2:27 PM


                    Here i=
s some food for thought. I am currently reviewing my audio from our May 30t=
h investigation.

                    It was me and another girl teammate p=
resent in the room. I picked up a 3rd female voice on my digital voice reco=
rder that I carry with me. We were standing right next to another digital v=
ideo recorder that I leave beside my night vision camera. That recorder did=
 not pick up this 3rd voice. I have asked the girl that was with me to chec=
k her recording to see if she picked it up.

                    I have lon=
g felt the true EVP does not come from sound waves in the environment, or t=
hen it wouldn't be EVP, but a disembodied voice. Somehow EVP's are appearin=
g directly on the recordings.

                    This instance with the r=
ecorders may back that theory up. That other recorder should have picked th=
at voice up if it were sound waves in the environment.

                   =
 I am attaching the clip of this 3rd voice. The file that is named "01-02-1=
7 Clip" is the full clip. You will hear my voice as I say "Yeah", and then =
another comes in right after that. I think I know what it says.

          =
          Again, I was live monitoring my audio, but still did not hear thi=
s until playback. It isn't clear, so I am not as excited about it as my one=
's from the last investigation.


                      ----- Original Mess=
age ----- 
                      From: Frank Ratka 
                      T=
o: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com 
                      Sent: Monday, June 08, 2=
009 1:09 PM
                      Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas


      =
                      I have a running theory that EVP is carried on an unt=
rasonic wave and demodulated exactly where they want it to manifest. It wor=
ks off the heterodyne principle. If you mix two ultrasonic waves that diffe=
r one another in frequency then if you add or subtract them together you ge=
t a beat frequency or alternate frequency. For example, if a ghost is sendi=
ng a signal at 54KHz and you have an electric fan in a room creating an unt=
rasonic frequency at 45KHz then you will have a intermediate difference fre=
quency at 9KHz, well within human hearing range (20Hz to 20KHz). This was j=
ust an example, but all electronic equipment generates ultrasonic signals j=
ust by turning them on. From this theory I always felt that EVP were genera=
ted within a few inches of the recorder.

                            We ar=
e able to reproduce this affect in not only radio with superheterodyne syst=
ems but also with acoustics and audio as in some passive sonars and a comme=
rcial produce called the "audio spotlight" by Dr. Joseph Pompeii.

        =
                    Frank R.

                            --- On Mon, 6/8/0=
9, Zack Widup <w9sz.zack@gmail. com> wrote:


                             =
 From: Zack Widup <w9sz.zack@gmail. com>
                              Subj=
ect: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas
                              To: EVP-ITC@yaho=
ogroups .com
                              Date: Monday, June 8, 2009, 1:56=
 PM


                              Fascinating! I've had this idea that th=
e EVP are often not recorded by the microphone but somehow make their way i=
n at the actual point where the storage is made, whether it be analog (tape=
) or digital. 

                              So much we don't know ...

  =
                            Zack

                               
         =
                     On Mon, Jun 8, 2009 at 1:39 PM, April Abercrombie <apr=
il@abercrombiegh ostresearch. com> wrote:




                             =
   I monitor my audio live. The funny thing is that even so, those last EVP=
's I captured I did not hear either in the environment, or on my recording =
as it happened. I only heard them upon playback.

                         =
       ----- Original Message ----- 
                                From: =
Zack Widup 
                                To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com 
 =
                               Sent: Monday, June 08, 2009 11:40 AM
       =
                         Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas


               =
                 I am curious if anyone with a microphone wired to a remote=
 site has ever gotten any EVP in real time.

                              =
  I took part in an investigation of Ashmore Estates, near Ashmore IL, on S=
aturday night. We had six video cameras set up in the three halls of the bu=
ilding. The video for all was being monitored and recorded at a central loc=
ation. Alas, we did not have microphones at the camera sites conected to th=
e central location. I wonder what we might have heard if we did?

         =
                       Zack

                                 
            =
                    On Mon, Jun 8, 2009 at 12:05 PM, threadsintyme@ juno.co=
m <Threadsintyme@ juno.com> wrote:


                                Let's =
just agree to end this discussion about her... 
                           =
     Why don't we discuss something on a lighter note? Anyone have any new =
ideas about either evp or ITC? 
                                Al

       =
